item.title: Chapter #10
item.description: < Previous | Contents ‌Chapter #10‌ Chapter title: Love is fragile like a flower. Hatred is powerful like a sword. 20 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall Question 1 WILL YOU PLEASE EXPLAIN TO ME THE LORD'S PRAYER, AS GIVEN BY JESUS? MEDITATION CAN BE EXPLAINED, prayer never. It can be understood, but it cannot be explained. Prayer is something of the heart, very elusive, very indefinable. You can feel it, but you cannot think it.

item.title: Chapter #2
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #2‌ Chapter title: Accept yourself as you are, and accept 12 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall Question 1 MANY TIMES I FEEL GUILTY BECAUSE I CANNOT RECEIVE YOU. The word "GUILT" should never be used. The very word has wrong associations; and once you use it you are caught in it. Guilt is not a natural phenomenon: it is created by the priests.

item.title: Chapter #3
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #3‌ Chapter title: There is no Future God; there is no past 13 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall MATTHEW I6 13 WHEN JESUS CAME INTO THE COASTS OF CAESAREA PHILLIPI, HE ASKED HIS DISCIPLES, SAYING, WHOM DO MEN SAY THAT I, THE SON OF MAN, AM? 14 AND THEY SAID, SOME SAY THAT THOU ART JOHN THE BAPTIST: SOME, ELIAS; AND OTHERS,JEREMIAS, OR ONE OF THE PROPHETS.

item.title: Chapter #4
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #4‌ Chapter title: Surrender is the door to bliss, to beauty, 14 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall Question 1 HOW WOULD YOU DESCRIBE YOUR PARTICULAR PATH TO ENLIGHTENMENT IN RELATIONSHIP TO OTHER TRADITIONAL PATHS SUCH AS THE VARIOUS KINDS OF YOGA, SUFISM, BUDDHISM, ZEN, CHRISTIANITY, ETCETERA? I HAVE NO particular path. I don't belong to any path whatsoever, and therefore all paths belong to me.

item.title: Chapter #6
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #6‌ Chapter title: A man who is enlightened has no masks, has 16 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall Question 1 I MYSELF AM A QUESTION. I KNOW NOT WHO I AM. WHAT TO DO? WHERE TO GO? REMAIN WITH THE QUESTION. Don t do anything, and don t go anywhere; and don't start believing in any answer. Remain with the question. That is one of the most difficult things to do -- to remain with a question, and not to seek the answer; because the mind is very cunning, it can supply a false answer.

item.title: Chapter #7
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #7‌ Chapter title: The more you love, the more fear disappears. 17 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall MATTHEW 22 35 THEN ONE OF THEM, WHICH WAS A LAWYER, ASKED HIM A QUESTION, TEMPTING HIM, AND SAYING, 36 MASTER, WHICH IS THE GREAT COMMANDMENT IN THE LAW 37 JESUS SAID UNTO HIM, THOU SHALT LOVE THE LORD THY GOD WITH ALL THY HEART, AND WITH ALL THY SOUL, AND WITH ALL THY MIND.

item.title: Chapter #9
item.description: < Previous | Contents | Next > ‌Chapter #9‌ Chapter title: Jesus is water of eternity, a divine well. 19 December 1975 am in Buddha Hall JOHN 7 25 THEN SAID SOME OF THEM OF JERUSALEM... 27 HOWBEIT WE KNOW THIS MAN WHENCE HE IS: BUT WHEN CHRIST COMETH, NO MAN KNOWETH WHENCE HE IS. 28 THEN CRIED JESUS IN THE TEMPLE AS HE TAUGHT, SAYING, YE BOTH KNOW ME, AND YE KNOW WHENCE I AM: AND I AM NOT COME OF MYSELF, BUT HE THAT SENT ME IS TRUE, WHOM YE KNOW NOT.
